chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Bolstad

defendant.name: Bolstad, Jeffrey A
defendant.address: E9474 County Road Ss, Viroqua, WI 54665

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the status of the cases. Received an offer. Defendant not interested in accepting the offer. 
State is heard on analyst availability set in first position Dec 22nd.   
Attorney Zaleski requests January. 
20CF100 the State will be amending charge to a 6th offense.
Jury selection scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed; subject to UAs by L.E.; if positive or refused, must submit to a blood draw.

1:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

21CF13 and 22CF19 called. 

State is heard on bond modification. State feels that a signature bond would be inappropriate, State has no further comment. 
Attorney Zaleski is heard on bond modification. 

Clerk checks on bond money in 22CF19. History shows nothing has been paid.  
Court is heard on bond.  Warrants to be canceled.  
Court orders in 22CF13 bond remains as is. 
Court orders in 22CF19 Bond to be modified to $500.00 cash bond. Conditions remain the same.
Motion hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:39 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

21CF13 and 22CF19 called together 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the non appearance of the defendant. 
Court recommends that Attorney Zaleski contact the court to set up a new date. 
Attorney Steiner is heard and believes that a warrant would be appropriate. 
Court will authorize a warrant, court will not sign it until next Wednesday September 28th.
This gives Attorney Zaleski the appropriate amount of time to make contact with the defendant, so this case can be put on for another hearing date.
Motion hearing on September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Found to be eligible for Drug Court if so ordered.
Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 8/31/22 response to same
Treatment Court Letter
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:37 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad appeared by video, in custody at the Vernon County Jail.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Judge Rider appeared by video. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard. 

22CF19 is set for a Preliminary hearing today.  Attorney Zaleski is heard and ready to proceed with preliminary hearing. 

State calls first witness. 
1W - J. Breeser, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner. 
Cross by Attorney  Zaleski 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Defense objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard and prepared to move forward with arraignment today. 

Defendant is heard, requests treatment court. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad appeared by video, in custody from the Vernon County Jail.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad. Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF19 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Defendant states understanding. 

Atty Zaleski is heard on bond modification request. 
Atty Steiner is heard on the bond modification request. State opposes a bond modification. State is not opposed to a furlough for the defendant to attend funeral services. 
Defendant is heard. 
Atty Zaleski is heard on furlough options. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court will not modify bond. 
Court grants a 48 hour furlough for defendant to attend services. 
Court approves a furlough - defendant must be on an Electronic Monitoring device or in the presence of a Law Enforcement officer during furlough.   


21CF13 & 20CF100 -  all cases will continue track along with each other.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bond
for bond modification
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed; subject to UAs by L.E.; if positive or refuses, must submit to a blood draw.
Initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:02 PM Call to Order by Court for all three cases.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad appeared by audio, in custody from Vernon Cty. Jail.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jeffrey A Bolstad.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court cancels all warrants.
     D.A. asks bond remains on two cases (20CF100 & 21CF13) which has been set; on 22CF19, requests $2,500 cash, not possess/consume any controlled substance; testing per L.E. to monitor compliance.  Notes last appearance was in April, 2021.
     Atty. Zaleski states Def. is indigent; is on a cash bond in Vernon Cty., which he is not able to pay (thought it was $2,000); suggests $500 is a reasonable bond now.
     Court comments.  Court orders bond as is in 20CF100 and 21CF13, cancels those warrants.  Court orders in 22CF19, $2,500 cash bond; not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed; subject to UAs by L.E.; if positive or refused, must submit to a blood draw.  
     #22-CF-19 - Def. has not rcvd. a complaint; to be set for an Initial Appearance.  Def. comments.  Other cases to ride along with this case.
     Court concludes at 1:11 p.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Steven Zaleski
State Public Defender's Office indicates Mr. Bolstad called their office from the Vernon County Jail.  He does qualify for a public defender and they will work on finding him an attorney.

2:25 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey A Bolstad not in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

DA requests a warrant for failure to appear. $250.00 cash bond out.

Court will issue a warrant and be held for further hearing.
